name: Laurocerasus
Relationship: Compare: HYDROCY-AC.; CAMPHOR; SECALE; AMMON. CARB.; AMBRA.

Heart: Spells of deep sleep, with snoring and stertorous breathing
Fever: Thirst, with dry mouth in afternoon
Respiratory: Cyanosis and dyspnoea; worse, sitting up
Cough, with copious, jelly-like, or bloody expectoration
GASPING FOR BREATH; clutches at heart
Extremities: Toe and finger nails become knotty
Sprained pains in hips, thighs and heels

details: Spasmodic tickling cough, especially in cardiac patients, is often magically influenced by this drug. LACK OF REACTION, especially in chest and heart affections. DRINK ROLLS AUDIBLY THROUGH ESOPHAGUS AND INTESTINES. General coldness, not ameliorated by warmth. Violent pain in stomach with loss of speech. Spasm of facial muscles and oesophagus. Asphyxia neonatorum.
dosage: Tincture, to third potency. Cherry-laurel water, two to five drop doses.
